isis.stitle: Recall 96511 - Detroit Diesel Engines With Optimized Idle

recall.subject: Detroit Diesel Engines With Optimized Idle

defect.para: This Recall applies to 9200, 9300, 9400 and 9800 models built from 04/03/1996 through 09/16/1996 with code 12VWS, plus other vehicles with engines that could be retrofitted. Detroit Diesel will notify Navistar customers with vehicles involved in this recall. The Detroit Diesel Service outlets will install a new ECM and add a relay in the ignition circuit. No action is required by International dealers.

Detroit Diesel will be conducting a safety recall on International 9000 series with the Optimized Idle option, code 12VWS, plus any vehicle with an engine that could be retrofitted with this feature. Optimized Idle is a software and hardware system which controls automatic starting and stopping of a diesel engine to maintain cab/sleeper temperature and engine temperature when the vehicle is sitting idle. The system has safeguards to keep the engine from cranking when the transmission is in gear or when the hood or cab is tilted. Because of a design error, the safety switches will not prevent the engine from cranking under certain conditions. With the ignition in the "ON" position and if power is broken to the electronic control module (ECM) from the fuses or ignition relay, the ECM can ground itself through a diode within the ECM and cause the engine to crank.

para.emph: An unexpected cranking of the engine could pose a hazard to a person positioned in the vicinity of the engine and cause personal injury and/or the vehicle could unexpectedly move, which could cause personal injury, property damage or both.

note.para: This is an information letter only - no action is required by the dealer.
